author: ghost
body:
I have an issue when using Get-PSDrive on an Azure Virtual Machine
If I run this command, usually it should return free disk space. However, when I ran this command,  there's no free disk data returned.
![powershell](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57062529/94767761-f355aa00-03df-11eb-824a-26cdbe8e655d.png)

I have done the following steps
1. run powershell as administrator but no change
2. checked Windows OS version: Windows Server 2016 Datacenter-10.0.14393.0
3. checked Powershell version: 5.1.14393.3866

I have another Azure VM which has the same environment but I can run this command to get free disk space successfully.

May I know how this command get free disk space from disk? Is it possible to fix this issue?
Besides, if it’s possible to see the source code of this command? As I checked the module which this command belongs to, I found this command is not listed.
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Management/commands/management

comments.author: iSazonov
anmenaga
comments.body:
@EricZhu0510 2 commands that will give additional diagnostics info:
```
Get-Command Get-PSDrive                   
$PSVersionTable
```

@iSazonov is correct that if this repros only in Windows PowerShell, but not PowerShell Core, then unfortunately there is not much we can do about it at this point.

PS. [`Get-PSDrive` source code is here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/5aca8637ae5c420723f92c3c5b33e8f6163ae269/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Management/commands/management/Navigation.cs#L1662).

title: Get-PSDrive will not return free disk space
